title: Astroscale to restart debris-removal demo with half the thrusters
summary: Astroscale plans to resume an attempt to capture a satellite acting as a piece of debris in low Earth orbit despite losing half the servicer’s eight thrusters.

title: NASA Awards Contract for Modeling, Simulation Capabilities to ANSYS
summary: NASA has awarded ANSYS Inc of Canonsburg, Pennsylvania, a contract to provide a suite of modeling and simulation tools including capabilities in the following engineering disciplines: structures, crash, thermal, fluids, photonics, semiconductors, electromagnetics, materials, mission, test, evaluation, and orbit determination.

title: Getting a jump on traffic: The sudden urgency of government-industry partnerships in space traffic management
summary: There is a trend of growing private sector capabilities to track objects and warn of potential conjunctions.

title: Arianespace, ULA, Blue Origin discuss executing ambitious Kuiper constellation missions for Amazon
summary: Amazon’s announcement of three launch contracts totaling 83 flights split across Ariane 6, Vulcan, and New Glenn represents the largest commercial launch block buy in history and will unite Arianespace, United Launch Alliance, and Blue Origin in a multi-year effort to deploy the Kuiper internet constellation.

title: Path to sustainable space unclear after Russia’s Ukraine invasion
summary: Before Russia invaded Ukraine, many considered international space cooperation safely insulated from geopolitical strife.

title: Starlink loses French spectrum license
summary: SpaceX has lost the right to provide Starlink broadband services in France after the country’s highest administrative court revoked its spectrum license.

title: NASA's Curiosity Mars Rover Reroutes Away From 'Gator-Back' Rocks
summary: To avoid patches of knife-edged rocks, the mission has taken an alternative path up Mount Sharp.

title: E-Space sheds more light on sustainable megaconstellation plan
summary: Megaconstellation startup E-Space is preparing to deploy the first of potentially hundreds of thousands of satellites on a Rocket Lab mission slated for no earlier than April 19.

title: Antonov shortage threatens delivery delays for the biggest satellites
summary: A shortage of Ukrainian Antonov aircraft raises the prospect of more delays for satellite projects already bogged down by supply chain issues.

title: SpaceX to launch quartet of mini geostationary satellites in 2023
summary: Startup Astranis has purchased a dedicated Falcon 9 launch from SpaceX for four miniature geostationary communications satellites. Known as MicroGEO, the comparatively...
